usefulItems: large bowl, plastic wrap or kitchen towel, ThermoMat, baking tray and paper, wire rack, pastry brush, oven, oven
title: Milk bread

ingredients.content: 50 g butter, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Place full cream milk, butter, yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and heat <b>3 min/37°C/speed 2<b>. Meanwhile, lightly grease a large bowl and set aside.

Add baker's flour and salt and knead <b>3 min/<b>. The dough will be slightly sticky. If the dough is very wet, add 1 tbsp extra flour and knead a further <b>30 sec/<b>, if necessary. Place dough into prepared bowl, cover with plastic wrap or a damp kitchen towel and leave to prove in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).

Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside. Transfer dough onto a ThermoMat or lightly floured work surface. Divide dough into 3 pieces and roll each piece into a long thin 'rope' (approx. 45 cm). Join the 3 'ropes' at one end, plait, and join again at the other end. Place plaited dough onto prepared baking tray, cover with plastic wrap or a damp kitchen towel and leave to prove again in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 30 minutes). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C.
Once dough has proved, brush with beaten egg and bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) or until bread sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Allow to cool on a wire rack then slice and serve.

hintsAndTricks: Sprinkle with flaked almonds or pearl sugar after brushing with egg.
One minute before the end of step 2, add 80 g raisins.
Form dough into small men, using raisins for eyes and buttons.
